description: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
descriptionMD: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
name: ACSP macOS Support Essentials 10.13
subtitle: Apple Certified Support Professional

episodes.description: Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification confirms the candidate's understanding of macOS's core functionality as well as having the ability to configure key services, perform basic troubleshooting, and support multiple users with essential macOS capabilities. Candidates for this course may be in a role of help desk professional, technical coordinator, or power user who supports macOS users, manages networks, or provides technical support for the Mac.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a look at prerequisites for getting macOS High Sierra installed. He also discusses the hardware requirements as well as the platforms that are supported by macOS High Sierra.
episodes.title: Getting Prepared

episodes.description: In this episode, Don walks the viewer through the process of installing macOS High Sierra on a supported device. He talks about some of the considerations as well as the various options that are available when installing the operating system.
episodes.title: Installing macOS High Sierra

episodes.description: In this episode, Don dives into the world of recovering the macOS High Sierra operating system when failures arise. He discusses some of the common symptoms that might manifest themselves, the options available during the recovery process as well as demonstrating that process.
episodes.title: OS Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes you through the initial setup configuration for a new or recently installed macOS system. He explains and demonstrates the 5 basic setup steps which include migrating existing data, configuring networking, configuring user accounts, adjusting system preferences, and configuring software updates.
episodes.title: Initial Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes you through the initial setup configuration for a new or recently installed macOS system. He explains and demonstrates the 5 basic setup steps which include migrating existing data, configuring networking, configuring user accounts, adjusting system preferences, and configuring software updates.
episodes.title: Initial Configuration Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don explores user accounts in macOS 10.13. Here you will learn about the types of user accounts that you may need to configure including Administrators, Standard, Managed with Parental Controls, and Sharing Only. He also explores special accounts like the Guest and Root accounts.
episodes.title: Managing User Accounts

episodes.description: In this episode, Don explores user accounts in macOS 10.13. Here you will learn about the types of user accounts that you may need to configure including Administrators, Standard, Managed with Parental Controls, and Sharing Only. He also explores special accounts like the Guest and Root accounts.
episodes.title: Managing User Accounts Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don explores working with multiple user accounts in macOS 10.13. He demonstrates the Fast User Switching feature and Parental Controls. These allow you to quickly switch users without needing to close running programs and restrict features of the OS respectively.
episodes.title: Multiple User Accounts

episodes.description: In this episode, Don demonstrates a few ways to secure your Mac through user account security. He begins by showing you how to enable a firmware password. Then he shows how to configure/reset user passwords. Finally, he explores the Keychain, iCloud, FileVault, and Privacy controls.
episodes.title: User Account Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Don introduced us to the ways macOS handles disks and their associated data. He details the various file systems supported by macOS High Sierra, demonstrates how to prepare a drive for use, and walks us through some troubleshooting procedures should the need arise.
episodes.title: File Storage

episodes.description: In this episode, Don introduced us to the ways macOS handles disks and their associated data. He details the various file systems supported by macOS High Sierra, demonstrates how to prepare a drive for use, and walks us through some troubleshooting procedures should the need arise.
episodes.title: File Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Don demonstrates encrypting disks using FileVault v2. He also explains how to upgrade from the original FileVault. He ends the episode by discussing how to securely erase files from the hard drive.
episodes.title: Securing Data

episodes.description: In this episode Don demonstrates encrypting disks using FileVault v2. He also explains how to upgrade from the original FileVault. He ends the episode by discussing how to securely erase files from the hard drive.
episodes.title: Securing Data Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don introduces us to file permissions in macOS High Sierra. He shows how permissions are set by default and how they follow the UNIX UGO model. Don also explains the different types of permissions and how Access Control Lists are different from the UGO permissions found in macOS High Sierra.
episodes.title: File Permissions

episodes.description: In this episode, Don goes more in-depth into file permissions by showing how to manipulate them from the terminal. He demonstrates the use of chmod and chown and how to change the access control lists. Also demonstrated is how the metadata is retained for files in macOS High Sierra.
episodes.title: File Permissions Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a look at some of the default file permissions for the home folder and the shared folder. He also discusses repairing permissions and some of the issues that can arise when using permissions with removable drives too.
episodes.title: File Permissions Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Don dives into managing files. He demonstrates how to create and use aliases. Additionally, he discusses how to use and create UNIX style links. Finally, he explains how macOS handles .app and .pkg files.
episodes.title: Managing Files

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a look at hidden system folders. Don shows how to view the hidden system folders and emphasizes some of the places in which the folders appear to be redundant. This redundancy is really about the scope of what is effected that is File Domains, according to Don. He also takes the time to point out special folders and what their importance is to the OS.
episodes.title: Managing Files Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don demonstrates using ZIP archives to combine and compress files for storage or transport. He then demonstrates creating DMG file images which are commonly used for software distribution.
episodes.title: Archives and Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Don explains the function and use of Time Machine as the macOS built-in backup solution. He shows you how to set up Time Machine to take backups, configuration settings to fine tune with, and restoring in the event of a failure.
episodes.title: Time Machine

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a look at installing applications. He demonstrates how to install an application from the App Store and from a non-App Store source. He also takes a look at how features like Gatekeeper and Mission Control interact with apps.
episodes.title: Managing Applications

episodes.description: In this episode, Don dives into how macOS handles application data. He shows how application files are stored on disk and how to locate related files that are not immediately visible by default.
episodes.title: Application Data

episodes.description: In this episode, Don continues with application data. First, he demonstrates using Quick Look to preview file contents without using a third party application. He then moves on to demonstrate using Auto Save to ensure our work is protected even in the event an application is closed.
episodes.title: Application Data Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a look at application support in macOS 10.13 High Sierra. He starts by looking at support for Java (both Apple's version and Oracle's version), and then addresses iCloud as an application framework.
episodes.title: Application Support

episodes.description: In this episode, Don continues exploring application support in macOS 10.13 High Sierra. He picks back up by looking at accessibility and voice features. He also covers features like Siri, VoiceOver, Dictation, and Speech.
episodes.title: Application Support Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don continues to explore application support in macOS 10.13 High Sierra. He discusses application improvements in High Sierra including application sandboxing, application monitoring, and Diagnostic reporting and logging.
episodes.title: Application Support Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a dive into network configuration in macOS 10.13. He begins by exploring physical and wireless network connections. Next he introduces you to the protocols and addressing used to create network connections. This includes TCP/IP, IPv4, IPv6, and MAC.
episodes.title: Network Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a dive into network configuration in macOS 10.13. He begins by exploring physical and wireless network connections. Next he introduces you to the protocols and addressing used to create network connections. This includes TCP/IP, IPv4, IPv6, and MAC.
episodes.title: Network Configuration Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a dive into network configuration in macOS 10.13. He begins by exploring physical and wireless network connections. Next he introduces you to the protocols and addressing used to create network connections. This includes TCP/IP, IPv4, IPv6, and MAC.
episodes.title: Network Configuation Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a more detailed look into advanced network configurations. He shows you how to define network locations which allows you to have multiple network settings on a single adapter based on the location. He also shows you how to configure the built-in VPN client.
episodes.title: Advanced Network Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode, Don walks the viewers through the various ways macOS can make resources available through the network. He demonstrates using file sharing, printer sharing, remote management and Internet connection sharing. He also does an extra demonstration of the Apple Remote Desktop utililty.
episodes.title: Sharing Resources

episodes.description: In this episode, Don walks the viewers through the various ways macOS can make resources available through the network. He demonstrates using file sharing, printer sharing, remote management and Internet connection sharing. He also does an extra demonstration of the Apple Remote Desktop utililty.
episodes.title: Sharing Resources Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes a look at using iCloud in macOS 10.13. He explains what iCloud is and its advantages, which include features like cloud storage, KeyChain credential synchronization, Back to My Mac, and Find My Mac.
episodes.title: Using iCloud

episodes.description: In this episode, Don explores expanding your Mac's capabilities through peripheral devices. He goes over the different types of common peripheral devices like storage, input/output devices, and communications. He also covers driver support for 3rd party devices.
episodes.title: Peripheral Devices

episodes.description: In this episode, Don looks into supporting printers in macOS High Sierra. He covers topics like connection types, printer drivers, managing the print queue, and sharing print devices with other users.
episodes.title: Supporting Printers

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes on the task of troubleshooting issues with macOS High Sierra if/when they arise. He explores the troubleshooting process starting with the boot process through to the loading of the operating system, login, and logout. He also covers system recovery options and some "hidden" system shortcuts and diagnostics.
episodes.title: System Troubleshooting

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes on the task of troubleshooting issues with macOS High Sierra if/when they arise. He explores the troubleshooting process starting with the boot process through to the loading of the operating system, login, and logout. He also covers system recovery options and some "hidden" system shortcuts and diagnostics.
episodes.title: System Troubleshooting Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Don takes on the task of troubleshooting issues with macOS High Sierra if/when they arise. He explores the troubleshooting process starting with the boot process through to the loading of the operating system, login, and logout. He also covers system recovery options and some "hidden" system shortcuts and diagnostics.
episodes.title: System Troubleshooting Part 3
